intro: Frenela roei, commonly known as the narrow-leafed fern, is a species of fern native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky outcrops. Its rhizome is creeping and produces both roots and new shoots. The fronds are usually bi- or tri-pinnate, with a delicate, feathery appearance.
